We then summarise the Îº and R estimates via the AIC-weighted model averaging. The AIC weights, w, of the selected models (with positive partial R-squared) are defined in Eqn ( 2),

Here, AIC
i is the AIC of the i-th selected model and the AIC min is the lowest AIC among all selected models. Thus, the i-th selected model has a weight of w
i . The model-averaged estimator is the weighted average of the estimates in each selected model, which has been well studied in previous work [ 16, 29].
